greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{d^k|n, d>1, k>1} prime(A286561(n,d)-1), where A286561(n,d) gives the highest exponent of d dividing n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
program: (PARI) A293515(n) = { my(m=1,v); fordiv(n,d,if(d>1, v = valuation(n,d); if(v>1, m *= prime(v-1)))); m; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 11 2017
